priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Pharmacogenomics Findings Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116105

self.title: CDISC SDTM Pharmacogenomics Findings Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that describe pharmacogenomics findings.
name: Pharmacogenomics Findings Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Pharmacogenomics Findings Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: The determination of which version of the gene is on each chromosome.

A subgroup of alleles of a polymorphic gene that may form clusters (e.g., phylogenetic) based on high sequence similarity, which may include either a shared single nucleotide polymorphism or a shared set of polymorphic sites. (CDISC)
The number of base pairs present in an RNA or DNA sequence that is the product of an amplification process.
The determination of the holistic or specific regional aberrations in a chromosome (insertions, deletions, amplifications, translocations).
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.

An indication of the magnitude difference between two values specified as the number of multiples of the first value to the second value (e.g., from 10 to 20 is a 2-fold increase, from 10 to 50 is a five-fold increase). (NCI)
The determination of the level of gene transcription in a biological specimen.
The determination of the variation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of an individual as compared to a reference sequence.
The determination of the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of an individual.

An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
An assessment of the variability in length of an individual microsatellite sequence.
The overall state or condition of the variability in length of multiple, assessed microsatellite sequences.
An assessment of the microsatellite repeat sequences within the genome, or a particular part of the genome.
The total number of nucleotide repeat markers tested that exhibit instability in a biological specimen. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Nucleotide Markers Exhibiting Instability
synonyms: Number of Nucleotide Markers Exhibiting Instability

terms.definition: The relative measurement (percentage) of nucleotide repeat markers exhibiting instability to all nucleotide repeat markers tested in a biological specimen. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Percent of Nucleotide Markers Exhibiting Instability
synonyms: Percent of Nucleotide Markers Exhibiting Instability
